listing_details: Seniority level: Mid-Senior level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Technology, Information and Internet
description:
The Solution Engineer will play a critical role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. Candidates must be adept at complex sales cycles with retail companies. Candidates must also be skilled at leading cross functional sales activities by engaging internal support team members and functional leaders across Professional Services, Marketing and Product Management. Daily activities include executive interactions with prospects and existing customers, conducting customer discovery sessions, qualifying prospects, responding to RFI/P’s, developing and executing sales strategies, delivering custom software demonstrations and presentations and collaborating with internal and external partners.Responsibilities

  • Partner with Account Executives to successfully identify, drive and close new business opportunities
  • Deliver tailored software demonstrations that address client challenges and goals
  • Lead technical discussions on the DemandTec by Acoustic solution and its ability to fit within a customer’s environment
  • Team effectively across the organization, pulling in resources as needed, to ensure that we are positioning and delivering a value based sales approach that results in territory quota attainment
  • Take the lead role in responding to RFP’s and Security questionnaires
  • Leverage the CRM as a sales accelerator and ensure accurate reporting

Requirements

  • 7+ years of experience leading complex sales cycles
  • Experience in solution engineering for SaaS to retail companies
  • Experience in solution engineering for SaaS to the “C-Suite” of clients
  • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional team members and executive leadership
  • Track record of over-achieving performance objectives
  • Proficient with corporate productivity and web presentation tools
  • Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong collaboration and teaming skills
  • Strong listening and presentation skills
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Information Technology, Industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:

listing_details: Seniority level: Associate, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Real Estate
description:
• To increase our client's ARR by providing technical leadership within the sales team, developing winning project proposals and being the subject matter expert on sales calls, clearly articulating technical details and benefits of our software and hardware solutions.


  • Increase the proposal win rate by a minimum of 10%
  • Complete a minimum of 10 proposals per week
  • Audit all internal quoting tools and improve them for speed, ease of use, and accuracy and to account for competitive pricing comps and historical deals where we were successful (and unsuccessful) to help us win more business
  • Evaluate and update the current ROI model and be able to quantify the benefits of each of our solutions
  • Become the bridge between sales and operations team. Meeting weekly to share insights from Sales calls and to gather feedback on proposal quality and implementation statuses
  • Run point on completing all RFIs and RFPs, collaborating with departmental leads to address any questions that require their expertise. Target 3-5 per quarter.
  • Share insights from sales conversations with our Product & Engineering teams on a weekly basis to help develop new features and improve the product offering
  • Participate in up to 5 sales meetings daily
  • Become an expert in hardware, software, and installation process and be able to explain fluently and in simple terms to a non-technical audience.


  • SaaS Technology Startup and CRE experience
  • Mechanical Engineer (a Masters is a plus)
  • Experience with value engineering and detailed proposal development
  • Has 5+ years of experience in a Sales Engineering or Solutions Engineering role and has been in numerous client-facing roles
  • Interprets an electrical and mechanical riser diagram and has a strong understanding of MEP diagrams
  • Wizard in Excel and Google Suite
  • Understands how building equipment and systems function and can provide detailed energy conservation measures (ECMs).
  • Has experience with Submetering, Building Management Systems, Networking and IoT devices
  • Has spent time in the field working with building owners, operators, property managers and engineers
  • Experience developing project scopes, proposals and closing business (at least in a support role)

listing_details: Seniority level: Associate, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering, Industries: Automation Machinery Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Warehousing and Storage
description:
Job description

Solutions Engineer

Location: Westfield, IN or Kansas City, MO

Employment Type: Full-Time

A solutions engineer will assist our sales force to support customers in meeting their business goals through automation project design. Solutions are developed utilizing customer data analysis, material handling system design, simulation, site visits and customer direction. This role allows you to work with some of the latest technologies in the ever-changing material handling field including robotics, mobile robotics, autonomous vehicles, AGV’s, and more with a goal of strengthening customer relationships & providing additional revenue opportunities to the company. The solutions engineer will be responsible for the system design and presenting that design to the customer within our flexible selling team. Reporting to the Vice President of Solutions Engineering, the Solutions Engineering Associate will play a vital role in developing & delivering training on solutions development to the sales & sales support teams.

OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Performs analysis of customers’ business requirements and develops solutions to meet or exceed customers’ needs. Conducts or oversees the development of proposal documents
  • Determines methodology for collecting, analyzing and summarizing data critical to design
  • Develops a wide range of concepts that meet or exceed the Design Criteria. Concepts may range from manual to fully automated solutions
  • To facilitate concept understanding, uses Autocad extensively to draw concepts in customers layout
  • Evaluates concepts and recommends the best solution. Skilled in using evaluation techniques ranging from simple “pro and con” comparisons to sophisticated Return on Investment (ROI) calculations
  • Stay up to date on all products/systems/offerings within the industry, including systems integration aspects and highly technical, complex solutions
  • Collaborate with the sales team members & customers to evaluate customer needs, design and present the best solution to the customer
  • Collaborate with sales team members to visit customer sites and interface with appropriate customer contacts
  • Develop and prepare effective proposals for solutions development to provide to Accounts/Prospects
  • Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule and project costs
  • Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope and budget
  • Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for delivery of innovative project solutions
  • Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress of each open development project
  • Participate in internal projects as required
  • Manage the workload assigned by the Vice President of Solutions Engineering

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS REQUIREMENTS

  • Highly detail oriented, ability to manage to critical deadlines
  • Ability to multitask effectively & prioritize & execute tasks
  • Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential
  • Ability to work through project issues with customers in a timely manner
  • Technically competent and proficient with various software programs: Excel, Word, Outlook, AutoCAD, SmartSheet
  • Strong written and oral communication skills: In person meetings, email, phone calls
  • Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies
  • Strong technical aptitude – highly knowledgeable of industry systems including complex integrated systems and components
  • BA/BS in Industrial Engineering or equivalent experience

PROFESSIONAL QUALITIES

  • Fast Paced Multi-Tasker
  • Attention to Details
  • Strong work ethic
  • Effective presentation skills
  • Ability to follow through with tasks given by colleagues and complete them on time
  • Ability to delegate tasks to team members with close follow up to ensure on time accurate completion

WORK CONDITIONS

  • Office & field oriented position with some overnight travel to project sites required
  • Overtime will be required when needed

Why work for Storage Solutions?

Headquartered in Westfield, Indiana, Storage Solutions has experienced stable growth for decades. The products and services we offer are in demand and the industry is continuously expanding.

Here are some of the benefits we offer:

  • Generous paid time off policies
  • Great medical, dental and vision plans
  • HSA contributions
  • A Variety of 401(k) options
  • Short and long-term disability insurance policies
  • Life insurance policies

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Work Location: In person

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Software Development
description:
Snap Inc is a technology company. We believe the camera presents the greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Snap contributes to human progress by empowering people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together. The Company’s three core products are Snapchat, a visual messaging app that enhances your relationships with friends, family, and the world; Lens Studio, an augmented reality platform that powers AR across Snapchat and other services; and its AR glasses, Spectacles.

Snap Engineering teams build fun and technically sophisticated products that reach hundreds of millions of Snapchatters around the world, every day. We’re deeply committed to the well-being of everyone in our global community, which is why our values are at the root of everything we do. We move fast, with precision, and always execute with privacy at the forefront.

We're looking for a Solutions Engineer to join Snap!

What you’ll do:

  • Build new products and improve existing ones
  • Collaborate with Snap product engineering teams and cross functional partners to meet business needs
  • Understand and apply deep knowledge of products, technologies, and business to build solutions to solve for problems at scale
  • Design and build end-to-end systems and launch-plan strategies
  • Use broad range of technical and soft skills to build productive relationships with partners and independently resolve complex technical and business needs while contributing to partner documentation
  • Apply expertise and product insight to deliver high-quality project/integration/partner engagements, while influencing product roadmap to meet the business needs
  • Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code
  • Build and improve solutions in collaboration with engineering, product, and cross functional partners
  • Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of partners
  • Work with partners to develop a long-term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Snap’s platform products and ensure value creation

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Ability to work with open source technologies
  • Ability to mentor and provide guidance to more junior team members
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Strong relationship development and collaboration skills

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS in a technical field such as computer science or equivalent years of experience
  • 1+ years of experience as a software or solutions engineer shipping reliable, scalable, and efficient code
  • Experience coding in Javascript, building applications and APIs/SDKs for internal and external developers.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced degree in computer science or computer engineering
  • Experience working with cross functional stakeholders to define business requirements and product roadmaps
  • Experience working with large SaaS, PaaS and cloud platforms and building applications for third-party marketplaces

"Default Together" Policy at Snap: At Snap Inc. we believe that being together in person helps us build our culture faster, reinforce our values, and serve our community, customers and partners better through dynamic collaboration. To reflect this, we practice a “default together” approach and expect our team members to work in an office at least 80% of the time (an average of 4 days per week). For roles with remote consideration: Remote team members still are expected to travel for mandatory in-person gatherings and to fulfill business needs, at least 4 to 6 times per year.

At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com.

Our Benefits: Snap Inc. is its own community, so we’ve got your back! We do our best to make sure you and your loved ones have everything you need to be happy and healthy, on your own terms. Our benefits are built around your needs and include paid maternity & paternity leave, comprehensive medical coverage, emotional and mental health support programs, and compensation packages that let you share in Snap’s long-term success!

Compensation

In the United States, work locations are assigned a pay zone which determines the salary range for the position. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These pay zones may be modified in the future.

Zone A (CA, WA, NYC):

The base salary range for this position is $130,000-$190,000 annually.

Zone B:

The base salary range for this position is $124,000-$181,000 annually.

Zone C:

The base salary range for this position is $111,000-$162,000 annually.

This position is eligible for equity in the form of RSUs.

listing_details: Seniority level: Mid-Senior level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Finance, Project Management, and Business Development, Industries: Financial Services
description:
Company Overview

ChargeAfter is pioneering the embedded lending network for point-of-sale consumer financing for merchants and financial institutions. Powered by a network of lenders and a data-driven matching engine, ChargeAfter streamlines the distribution of credit into a single, secure, and reliable embedded lending platform. Merchants can rapidly implement ChargeAfter’s omni-channel platform online, in-store, and at every point of sale, enabling them to provide personalized financing choices to their customers.

Here at ChargeAfter, we are building the next unicorn in the Fintech industry and are looking for a talented and success driven Solution Engineer to help make it happen!


Job Summary

We are seeking a talented and highly motivated Solution Engineer to join our team as an integral part of our strategic projects.

In this role, you will be responsible for engaging with partners, understanding their unique needs and requirements, and aligning our existing solutions to provide tailored solutions.

From pre-sales to post-sales, you will collaborate closely with our Solution Architects, product managers, and engineering teams to design, implement, test, and launch solutions for our partners.

Your technical expertise, communication skills, and experience in payment services will play a vital role in driving successful collaborations.


Responsibilities:

Partner Engagement:

  • Act as a primary technical point of contact for partners, maintaining effective communication and building strong relationships.
  • Conduct thorough needs analysis and requirement gathering to understand partners' business goals and challenges.
  • Collaborate with partners to identify opportunities where our embedded financing platform can provide value and drive business growth.

Solution Design and Implementation:

  • Work closely with Solution Architects, product managers, and engineering teams to design innovative and scalable solutions that meet partners' requirements.
  • Translate business and technical requirements into detailed solution specifications and functional designs.
  • Ensure the seamless integration of our embedded financing platform with partners' existing systems and infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to define and document technical implementation plans.

Sales and Business Development Support:

  • Support the sales team in pre-sales activities by conducting technical presentations, demonstrations, and solution walkthroughs to potential partners.
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance during partner negotiations and contract discussions.
  • Assist in the development of proposals and responses to RFPs/RFIs, ensuring alignment with partners' needs and objectives.

Project Management Support:

  • Working closely with partners and internal stakeholders to ensure successful delivery of technical aspects of project implementation
  • Conduct solution testing and coordinate with partners to resolve any technical issues or challenges.
  • Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting assistance to partners during the implementation and post-launch phases.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field (Master's degree preferred).
  • Proven experience (5+ years) working as a Solution Engineer or in a similar technical role, preferably in the payments industry, working with merchants and banks.
  • Strong understanding of software development methodologies, APIs, cloud services, web technologies, and system integration.
  • Big plus - previous experience as a software engineer, with proficiency in programming languages such as C#, Java, Python, or JavaScript.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
  • Experience with project management methodologies and tools.
  • Familiarity with financial technologies, POS systems, or e-commerce platforms is a plus.
  • Willingness to travel occasionally to meet with partners or attend industry conferences/events.


ChargeAfter provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, or disability status.

NYC Posting: In accordance with New York City Local Law 32, the expected salary for this role is between $90,000-$115,000. This role may be eligible for additional compensation in the form of bonuses and/or stock options. All offers to candidates will be based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to a candidate’s individual experience, skill set, background and other business and organizational needs.

listing_details: Seniority level: Mid-Senior level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Sales, Industries: Software Development
description:
Company Description

Press Ganey, the leading Human Experience (HX) healthcare performance improvement company, offers an integrated suite of solutions that address safety, clinical excellence, patient experience and workforce engagement. The company works with more than 41,000 healthcare facilities in its mission to reduce patient suffering and enhance caregiver resilience to improve the overall safety, quality, and experience of care. Press Ganey is a PG Forsta company.

Job Description

Press Ganey has an exciting opportunity for an HX Solutions Engineer whose primary responsibilities are to drive growth and expansion of HX Products through development of pre-sale demo experiences. This role is remote.

Duties & Responsibilities: 

  • The  Hx Solutions Builder is responsible for working alongside the account teams, building and configuring solutions and experiences facilitating the selling additional of Press Ganey product lines.
  • These clients consist of hospitals, health systems, medical practices, and other facilities.
  • The Hx Solutions Builder will lead efforts across their assigned territory with the inside sales team, the product overlays in region, and the account management and advisory members of the teams.
  • This position requires intermittent travel in order to develop strong working relationships with internal teammates across Sales, Product and Delivery

Qualifications

  • This position requires a high attention to detail with regards to maintaining demo environments with product examples with which Delivery and Product have familiarity and comfort, and which Sales has enthusiasm.
  • This individual must be able to work independently without supervision.
  • This position involves coordinating many moving parts and providing creative solutions to the complex cross domain problems inherent to crafting holistic solutions from the many Press Ganey products and technologies.
  • This individual must be able to think big picture and work to align stakeholders across multiple divisions and business units.
  • A minimum of three years technical experience is required. Background in Healthcare, SaaS, and survey/reporting development environments preferred. 

Additional Information

All positions at Press Ganey require an applicant who has accepted an offer to undergo a background check. The specific checks are based on the nature of the position. Background checks may include some or all of the following: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. By applying for a position with Press Ganey, you understand that you will be required to undergo a background check should you be made an offer. You also understand that the offer is contingent upon successful completion of the background check and results consistent with Press Ganey's employment policies. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required for the position.

Press Ganey Associates LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and well committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Notice – Press Ganey will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

The expected base salary for this position ranges from $100,000 to $110,000. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, licensure or certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to base salary and a competitive benefits package, successful candidates are eligible to receive a discretionary bonus or commission tied to achieved results.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our privacy policy can be found here: https://www.pressganey.com/legal-privacy/

listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Facilities Services
description:
InfraHire is looking for a Sr. Solution Engineer in New York, NY.


Job Description


The team is looking for an experienced solutions engineer who will be able to develop these capabilities and their proof of concepts together with the engineering team (before the full product process), and formalize procedures to onboard large enterprises to the platform.


Key Responsibilities


  • Work closely with Security and DevOps teams of new customers to design and implement tailor-made solutions to their architecture.
  • Functioning as a subject matter expert for Cloud Providers' architectures, Infrastructure-as-code, and complex product deployments for customers.
  • Work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to communicate customers' requirements and deliver generic solutions for repeating requirements.
  • Ideate and design new solutions to help our customers gain more value from platform.
  • Create innovative resources to equip and educate customers and peers: knowledge base articles, repositories, Terraform models, etc.


Qualifications


  • 5+ years of experience as a Solutions Engineer working with large enterprises in the space of Cloud Solutions/Services
  • Strong technical background with expertise in Public Cloud Providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and all of their services, Kubernetes, etc
  • Strong expertise in Infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Cloudformation)
  • Fundamental knowledge of Python, using APIs, SDKs, and CLI
  • Strong people skills and ability to deliver complex messaging in a clear and logical manner
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or other related field - advantage
  • Experience in the space of Cloud Security / GRC - advantage


InfraHire is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

listing_details: Seniority level: Mid-Senior level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Engineering and Information Technology, Industries: Software Development
description:
Coast is looking for a Founding Solutions Engineer who will primarily focus on post-sale implementation, support and success. This role will eventually help build a team beneath them.


What We Do


Coast helps API-first companies effectively demo their software. Our platform turns stale API docs into personalized and interactive demos for sales, marketing and implementation.


Where Are We


We support the world's leading API-first companies across Fintech, Healthtech, Fraud and more. We're backed by world class investors like Y Combinator.


What We're Looking For


Strong experience working with and integrating vendor APIs. Ability to work with customers on technical problem solving with strong written and verbal communication skills.


Excited to work at an early stage startup, where you will move fast, have a lot of autonomy and make a direct impact on a daily basis.


Living in NYC and able to work in person 3 days a week.

job_title: ENTRUST Solutions Group - Entry Level Design Engineer I - Transmission Line - 117
listing_details: Seniority level: Entry level, Employment type: Full-time, Job function: Sales and Business Development, Industries: Utilities
description:
• NEW GRADUATES ENCOURAGED TO APPLY!*

﻿

What You’ll Do:

  • Responsible for design of low to high voltage electric transmission lines and/or distribution
  • Complete engineering tasks such as layout, planning, directing, training, and coordinating civil/structural analysis; Calculations, construction drawings, contracts, design standards, and technical specifications as it applies to transmission lines and/or distribution with supervision by other engineers and supervisors
  • Assist in developing engineering and drawing packages for bidding, construction, as-built, and submittal purposes

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or Structural Engineering from an ABET accredited university
  • Ability to travel up to 25% as needed for projects and client visits

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Interest in obtaining or currently in process of obtaining EIT certification
  • Exposure to transmission line design projects within the utilities industry

Not quite right for you? For a full listing of all our openings, please visit us at:

https://entrustsol.com/careers/

Who We Are:

ENTRUST Solutions Group, an ENR Top 100 company, is a community of people, 3,000+ strong, who are committed to our clients and each other. We provide comprehensive and dependable engineering, consulting, and automation services to gas and electric utilities, telecommunication service providers, pipeline operators, and industrial companies.

In return for top talent, ENTRUST Solutions Group offers:

  • Generous paid time off and benefits
  • 401(k) retirement program with a company match
  • Career development programs
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Flexible work schedule

To learn more about ENTRUST Benefits and Culture, please visit our company LinkedIn page and follow us at:

https://www.linkedin.com/company/entrustsolutionsgroup

ENTRUST Solutions Group is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers.
